meanings.definition: To come into contact with forcefully and suddenly.
meanings.sent1: She bumped into the table and spilled her drink.
meanings.sent2: The car bumped over the pothole in the road.
meanings.sent3: The cat bumped the vase, and it wobbled but didn't fall.
meanings.sent4: His heart bumped with excitement as he approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The basketball bumped against the backboard before going through the hoop.

meanings.sent1: He bumped his knee on the edge of the bed.
meanings.sent2: The suitcase bumped down the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter bumped the tray, causing a domino effect of falling dishes.
meanings.sent4: The sudden noise bumped him out of his daydream.
meanings.sent5: The boat bumped against the dock as it was tied up.

meanings.definition: To move or travel with a jolting motion.
meanings.sent1: The old bus bumped along the uneven road.
meanings.sent2: The wagon bumped over the rocky terrain.
meanings.sent3: The toy car bumped into the wall and changed direction.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's feet bumped lightly on the stage floor.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster bumped passengers up and down along the track.
